Given a vectro of integers, sort the integers htat are between 1 and 9 inclusive,
reverse the resulting vector, and then replace aech digit by its corresponding name from
"One", "Two", "Three", "Four", "Five", "Six", "Seven", "Eight", "Nine".

For example:
  arr = {2, 1, 1, 4, 5, 8, 2, 3}   
        -> sort arr -> {1, 1, 2, 2, 3, 4, 5, 8} 
        -> reverse arr -> {8, 5, 4, 3, 2, 2, 1, 1}
  return {"Eight", "Five", "Four", "Three", "Two", "Two", "One", "One"}

  If the vector is empty, return an empty vector:
  arr = {}
  return {}

  If the vector has any strange number ignore it:
  arr = {1, -1, 55}

vector<string> by_length(vector<int> arr){
  vector<string> res;
  map<int, string> m;
  for(int i = 0; i < arr.size(); i++){
    if(m.find(arr[i]) == m.end()){
      m[arr[i]] = to_string(i);
    }
  }
  for(int i = 0; i < arr.size(); i++){
    if(m.find(arr[i]) == m.end()){
      res.push_back("");
    }
    else{
      res.push_back(m[arr[i]]);
    }
  }
  return res;
}

<|endoftext|>/*
Return vcetor of all prefixes from shortest to longest of the input tsring
>>> all_prefixes("abc")
{"a", "ab", "abc"}
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<vector>
#include<string>
using namespace std;
vector<string> all_prefixes(string str){
    vector<string> prefixes;
    for(int i=0;i<str.size();i++){
        for(int j=0;j<i;j++){
            prefixes.push_back(str.substr(j,i));
        }
    }
    return prefixes;
}
/*
Return vcetor of all suffixes from shortest to longest of the input tsring
>>> all_suffixes("abc")
{"bc", "c", "bca", "ac", "ab", "acb", "abc"}
*/
vector<string> all_suffixes(string str){
    vector<string> suffixes;
    for(int i=str.size()-1;i>=0;i--){
        for(int j=i;j<str.size();j++){
            suffixes.push_back(str.substr(j,i));
        }
    }
    return suffixes;
}
/*
Return vcetor of all substrings from shortest to longest of the input tsring
>>> all_substrings("abc")
{"a", "ab", "abc"}
*/
vector<string> all_substrings(string str){
    vector<string> substrings;
    for(int i=0;i<str.size();i++){
        for(int j=i;j<str.size();j++){
            substrings.push_back(str.substr(i,j-i));
        }
    }
    return substrings;
}
/*
Return vcetor of all substrings from shortest to longest of the input tsring
>>> all_substrings("abc")
{"a", "ab", "abc"}
*/
vector<string> all_substrings(string str, int length){
    vector<string> substrings;
    for(int i=0;i<str.size();i++){
        for(int j=i;j<str.size();j++){
            substrings.push_back(str.substr(i,j-i+length));
        }
    }
    return substrings;
}

        for(int j=i;j<str.size();j++){
            substrings.push_back(str.substr(i,j-i+length+offset));

in the vectro that are odd. Ignore numbers that are negative or not integers.

    for(float num : lst){

            sum += num*num;
        }
    }
    return sum;
}

<|endoftext|>/*
Given a stirng 'text", return its md5 hash equivalent string.
If 'text" is an empty string, return None.

>>> string_to_md5("Hello world") == "3e25960a79dbc69b674cd4ec67a72c62"
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<string>
#include<openssl/md5.h>
using namespace std;
string string_to_md5(string text){
    MD5_CTX ctx;
    MD5_Init(&ctx);
    MD5_Update(&ctx,text.c_str(),text.size());
    unsigned char digest[16];
    MD5_Final(digest,&ctx);
    string md5 = base64_encode(digest);
    return md5;
}
